TopicTitle: [1.12.x] BetterTimeWarpContinued - Customizable Time Warp, and Lossless Physics Warp

Articles.Content:
Thanks for your answer.

I  already downloaded this files.

The "B" button appears, but when I click on it, nothing is happening...

And after installing, I check on CKAN, and it's written "Max KSP Version 1.0.5"

12 hours ago, Hache said:

Thanks for your answer.

I  already downloaded this files.

The "B" button appears, but when I click on it, nothing is happening...

And after installing, I check on CKAN, and it's written "Max KSP Version 1.0.5"

And do you have the dependencies installed?

a log file would be useful in diagnosing your problem

 

 

You are looking at the old entry for BTW.
i found a bug, when i make a maneuver node it points me in some stupid direction that's not where i wanted to go, it only happens when i have better time warp installed

On 4/14/2018 at 4:22 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

You download the wrong files.

Delete the directory, then download this:

https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/BetterTimeWarpContinued/releases/download/2.3.10/BetterTimeWarp-2.3.10.zip

and install it

I did it, again and again, after uninstalling and reinstalling KSP... I already tried this morning with KSP 1.4.3... same results :

https://app.box.com/s/cdoz6a9x64e8jnl3n1u6t6qcvtimg6zj

 

With CKAN, no matter how I install the app (by your link, spacedock...), it always recognizes the version 2.2 of Better time Warp... (never your work : 2.3.10)

https://app.box.com/s/gzed77cyjn7d703xuztda4hnzjw1kdp2

I'm frustrated because I think that your app is unavoidable and necessary !!!!

 

Edited April 29, 2018 by Hache
Ill take a look at ckan later

11 hours ago, Hache said:

I did it, again and again, after uninstalling and reinstalling KSP... I already tried this morning with KSP 1.4.3... same results :

https://app.box.com/s/cdoz6a9x64e8jnl3n1u6t6qcvtimg6zj

 

With CKAN, no matter how I install the app (by your link, spacedock...), it always recognizes the version 2.2 of Better time Warp... (never your work : 2.3.10)

https://app.box.com/s/gzed77cyjn7d703xuztda4hnzjw1kdp2

I'm frustrated because I think that your app is unavoidable and necessary !!!!

 

This is very strange, since it looks good in CKAN.

Did you clear the CKAN cache?

Check CKAN, make sure that you don't have 1.0 enabled in the Compatible Ksp Versions windw

 

Edited April 29, 2018 by linuxgurugamer

eh...

I wanted to find out how to clear CKAN cache, and I have checked on Setting/Compatible KSP Version , I have clicked on 1.3... Then I had could install BTWcontinued !!

Thanks !

Finally I can play again ! (going to Jool...)
I downloaded this, and extracted it in the GameData folder, yet it isnt appearing on my ksp game. What's happenning?

I really hope you tried to install the latest version into 1.4.1, your post is rather lacking in information.

Assuming you are using 1.4, because you didn't read the top of the OP, which specifically says:

The new version for KSP 1.4.1 has new dependencies

New Dependencies﻿

  • Click Through Blocker﻿﻿
  • ToolbarController
Apologies. I'm running 1.4.1, no DLC, with Both ToolbarController and Click Through Blocker installed. Yet, BetterTimeWarp is not loading, although everything else is installed correctly.

2 hours ago, Xurkitree said:

Apologies. I'm running 1.4.1, no DLC, with Both ToolbarController and Click Through Blocker installed. Yet, BetterTimeWarp is not loading, although everything else is installed correctly. 

 

 

A good place to start is to read LGG's signature which says:

Quote

Read this BEFORE asking for support: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/83212-how-to-get-support-read-first/

Well, I have reinstalled Click Through Blocker and Toolbar Manager, and while Precise node is working fine, BetterTimeWarp is still not loading.

Here's a log file - KSP Ver:1.4.3 ; Mods - MechJeb,TAC Fuel Balancer,KER, Precise Node, Click through Blocker, Toolbar Manager, Better Time Warp.

http://www.mediafire.com/file/9c1w3hdjqco3zyz/output_log.txt/file

Edited June 11, 2018 by Xurkitree

2 hours ago, Xurkitree said:

Well, I have reinstalled Click Through Blocker and Toolbar Manager, and while Precise node is working fine, BetterTimeWarp is still not loading.

Here's a log file - KSP Ver:1.4.3 ; Mods - MechJeb,TAC Fuel Balancer,KER, Precise Node, Click through Blocker, Toolbar Manager, Better Time Warp.

http://www.mediafire.com/file/9c1w3hdjqco3zyz/output_log.txt/file

There's definitely a problem, see this: 

ssemblyLoader: Exception loading 'BetterTimeWarp': System.Reflection.ReflectionTypeLoadException: The classes in the module cannot be loaded.
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Reflection.Assembly:GetTypes (bool)
  at System.Reflection.Assembly.GetTypes () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at AssemblyLoader.LoadAssemblies () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 

Additional information about this exception:

 System.TypeLoadException: Could not load type 'BetterTimeWarp.BetterTimeWarp' from assembly 'BetterTimeWarp, Version=2.1.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'.

 System.TypeLoadException: Could not load type '<>c__DisplayClass15' from assembly 'BetterTimeWarp, Version=2.1.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'.

Your problem is this:

      BetterTimeWarp-2.2.0.0.zip

 

Latest version is 2.3.10, please install the latest version
Thanks a lot!

New release, 2.3.10.1

  • Updated for all 1.4
  • Updated to use updated ToolbarControl
  • Removed blizzy options, now controlled the ToolbarControl
In CKAN the max KSP version is 1.4.1

Love the mod; works great with OPM and other such mods. I have one query though - when I use HyperWarp and run the 2 new speeds my craft keep having electricity spikes, resulting in "electricity run out" warnings.

Unfortunately, my Kerbals always die on said spike (as I also use TAC Life Support) so I am unable to use the mod effectively. Any ideas on how to circumvent this issue?

On 6/23/2018 at 9:17 PM, robertordf said:

In CKAN the max KSP version is 1.4.1

Clear you ckan cache, refresh and check again

When using any kind of time slowdown, I get that manuver-node dV shifts and orbits screwed up problem. I know it's been posted before, but I couldn't find a reply with a fix.

I also had a different problem, but I cannot reliably reproduce it. I was able to trigger it with TimeControl, but again, not reliably. Time deceleration causes the graphics to screw up: kerbin is not shown, ship is not shown, KSC is just the landing strip lights, star-system is a void.

when using lossless physics maneuver nodes behave odd, with the amount of delta-v needed changing constantly and the navball marker moving around.

I dont understand how to install this mod. It said to merge the game data with the KSP game data and so I did but didnt work, It seems odd to that all the other files are still in the original folder, so what do i do, move the entire folder just into the regular game data folder?

8 hours ago, Legal_Pyro said:

I dont understand how to install this mod. It said to merge the game data with the KSP game data and so I did but didnt work, It seems odd to that all the other files are still in the original folder, so what do i do, move the entire folder just into the regular game data folder?

What makes you think it's  not working?

Post a link to a log file, nobody can do anything without that

On 12/26/2017 at 1:09 AM, prykpryk said:

I also have this bug. I noticed that when in Tracking Station, mission elapsed times of crafts were increasing bit too fast (even though i was in 1x timewarp).

Turn off lossless physics warp, then exit to main menu.

Does anyone think the magical dV increasing is caused by the time running too fast in lossless physics warp?
Hey this is an amazing mod! I have noticed that when it is used with Camera Tools the camera goes apeexcrements sometimes.
Does it work with 1.5?
